newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish shares ease, seen challenging high.
newsitem.headline: Polish shares ease, seen challenging high.

text.p: Polish shares eased in stable turnover on Tuesday but buying was stronger after price fixing and analysts said the market seemed strong enough to slowly approach its July 5 high this week or early next.
But they were uncertain whether the market would then keep on rising or fall in profit-taking after hitting its 27-month record at 14,282.2 points of the main WIG index.

"We might have a tug-of-war between pessimists afraid the market could hit the high and fall afterwards and optimists believing it will keep rising," said Krzysztof Rogalski, an analyst at Bank Staropolski brokerage.
The WIG index fell 0.5 percent to 13,970.1 and turnover rose two percent to 101.3 million zlotys ($36.9 million) on both markets as 29 issues fell, 24 rose and 24 were flat.
Analysts said the news of the U.S. missile attack on Iraq was unlikely to affect Warsaw stock performance in the short term unless a more significant conflict ensued.
Analysts said stocks might also be affected next week by investors speculating ahead of companies' release of August earnings reports due in mid-September.
Continuous trade turnover was at 73,000 million zlotys ($26,642) with bank BIG and industrial and trading conglomerate Elektrim, the only stocks trading, staying flat.

Mass privatisation NFI units rose 1.6 percent to 95.5 zlotys ($34.9) in 9.3-million-zloty ($3.4 million) turnover in the single price auction system and were flat at 95.5 zlotys ($34.9) in 1.1-million zloty ($0.4 million) continuous trade.
